Class userlist

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.userlist
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class userlist
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    userlist is a list of all the users
    Author:
    Ran Sa, Jami Nicastro
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getList

        public java.util.ArrayList<user> getList()
        Get the arraylist that contains all the users
        Returns:
        The arraylist that contains all the users

      • add

        public int add(java.lang.String name,
               boolean b)
        add a user to the list of all users
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new user
        b - True if user want to add the new user to the list. False if user just want to test if the new user is valid
        Returns:
        Return the index of the new added user on success. Return 0 if the user already exist. Return 1 if the user is valid to add. Return -1 if the name field is empty

      • check

        public int check(java.lang.String name)
        check if the user is in the list
        Parameters:
        name - name of the user that needed to be checked
        Returns:
        Return -1 if teh user is not in the list. Return the index of user if it is in the list

      • remove

        public void remove(int i)
        remove a user from the list
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the user that need to be deleted

      • getUser

        public user getUser(int index)
        Get a user from a ceertain index
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the user you want to get
        Returns:
        The user on that index

      • writeData

        public static void writeData(userlist l)
